PROMPTS: A.I. SHOW 2.0In welcoming the return of GC Majors and celebrating 2025, I am presenting my second A.I. Show 2.0 in the lobby of Godfrey Hall. My exhibition examines the relationship between tradition and innovation, exploring the theme, "The value of an idea lies not in its originality but in its execution." The collection features works that bridge traditional techniques‚Äîsuch as acrylic painting‚Äîwith contemporary approaches like AI-generated imagery, demonstrating how the execution of an idea imbues it with meaning and resonance.From expressive self-portraits in acrylic to dynamic woodcut-inspired digital designs, the show invites viewers to consider the transformation of artistic concepts through diverse mediums. The interplay of natural phenomena, personal identity, and advanced technology offers a critical dialogue on the evolving role of execution in artmaking.Event Details:Location: Godfrey Hall lobby, Clemson UniversityDates: 1/21/2025 ‚Äì 2/28/2025This exhibit offers a compelling exploration of how artistic practices adapt, evolve, and redefine the boundaries of creative expression.

NSF has launched a new research funding opportunity in partnership with BASF , Dow , IBM , PepsiCo and Procter & Gamble seeking to accelerate the discovery and manufacture of superior and sustainable polymers to enhance national competitiveness and tackle global challenges such as plastic waste. Sustainable Polymers Enabled by Emerging Data Analytics (SPEED) is part of NSF's Molecular Foundations for Sustainability program. SPEED is one of several NSF efforts to advance fundamental research in sustainable chemistry, a national priority highlighted in the "CHIPS and Science Act of 2022" which called on NSF to support sustainable chemistry research and education by fostering collaborative research and development partnerships among universities, industry and other organizations. "Synthetic polymers are in many products and materials used by our society, from concrete and plastics to paper and rubber," says David Berkowitz, director of the NSF Division of Chemistry. "Melding frontier chemistry with advanced data science tools to design and commercialize new high-value polymers can reduce pollution and waste ‚Äî and ultimately enhance the health of our planet and the resiliency of our communities." Learn more: https://bit.ly/3wgExw0üì∑: Adobe Stock/generated with AI

‚ÄúWith new high-speed scanners and a dedicated team of digitization staff, this new center is a game changer for the National Archives,‚Äù said Archivist of the United States Dr. Colleen Shogan. The National Archives and Records Administration launched a state-of-the-art digitization center in College Park, Maryland, enabling faster access to the country's most important historical federal government records. Archivist of the United States Dr. Colleen Shogan, Rep. Steny Hoyer), Sen. Chris Van Hollen),¬† and Rep. Glenn Ivey took part in a ribbon-cutting ceremony April 12, 2024. High-speed scanners and overhead camera systems that can handle a range of records and formats are among the equipment in the new facility. The National Archives will be able to digitize up to ten times as many records annually with the use of this technology. The public will have access to millions more records due to these upgrades. The agency‚Äôs goal of making access happen to federal records is dependent on our ability to expedite the digitization of our more than 13 billion documents. Learn more on the National Archives News: https://lnkd.in/gnhQEhp5

"What is made possible by the investments we‚Äôve made?"That question was put to company leaders by David Bennett in 2015. He didn‚Äôt want to be better. He wanted to be different.It‚Äôs a challenging question. Some responses were easy. There were traditional projects that became easier to manage. There was simple direct mail. There were shorter run jobs.That wasn‚Äôt the answer David was looking for. He wanted to know what we could invent. He was looking for yet to be imagined services we might design.The resulting collaboration changed the trajectory of our company. Packaging was added. So we‚Äôre digital enhancements (SenseAtional)  and laser finishing (Director's Cut). They‚Äôre hot topics now but were outrageous gambles seven years ago.All of these things were done with the audience in mind. We wanted creatives to see possibilities not limitations. We wanted to test ideas in minutes not days. It has earned us some of the best work in the world. There have been countless awards but our clients deserve those. We‚Äôre proud to be part of making ideas come to life!WE LOVE THIS STUFF!

His response is legendary:"Why would I want ten Ferraris, 20 diamond watches and two jet planes? I starved, I worked in the fields, played barefoot, and I didn't go to school. Now I can help people. I prefer to build schools and give poor people food or clothing. I have built schools and a stadium; provide clothes, shoes, and food for people in extreme poverty. In addition, I give 70 euros per month to all people from a very poor Senegalese region in order to contribute to their family economy. Clemson University is launching a new full-spectrum advanced materials research and development center to drive breakthrough technological advancements for the state‚Äôs automotive, aerospace, defense and energy sectors. The Clemson Composites Center combines decades of expertise and state-of-the-art equipment to bring all stages of the engineering lifecycle under one institution. The first project will be the completion of assistant professor Srikanth Pilla‚Äôs $5.8 million research endeavor to redesign a driver‚Äôs side door to be lighter and stronger. The interdisciplinary team ‚Äî which includes the US Dept Of Energy and Honda R&D Americas, LLC ‚Äî will use the Center‚Äôs specialized equipment to build and validate the final prototype.

It is wonderful to see that the IRS and other agencies working to improve public awareness of cyber vulnerabilities. It is a simple but powerful message to emphasize:1. Security is essential, and people of all ages should not reveal too much information about themselves. 2. Always use security software with firewall and anti-virus protections. 3. Recognize and avoid scams such as phishing emails, threatening phone calls, and texts from thieves posing as IRS or from legitimate organizations pose risks. 4. Protect personal data and treat personal information like cash; don't leave it lying around.5. Be careful about public Wi-Fi networks as a connection to Wi-Fi in a mall or coffee shop is convenient, but it may not be safe. Always use a virtual private network when connecting to public Wi-Fi.Here is an excellent article by Information Security Magazine:https://lnkd.in/dpyFZ8B hashtag#cybereducation hashtag#stemeducation hashtag#cybersecurity hashtag#computersecurity hashtag#infosec hashtag#securityawareness
